Jesus Is Accused of Being Demon Possessed
     Jesus declared Himself to be the True Shepherd, because He gave His life for the sheep. . . . Jesus spoke these words in the hearing of a large concourse of people, and a deep impression was made upon the hearts of many who listened. The scribes and Pharisees were filled with jealousy because He was regarded with favor by many. . . . While He represented Himself as the True Shepherd, the Pharisees said, \93He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?\94 But others distinguished the voice of the True Shepherd, and said:
